name: GetDraftHubdbTableRows
description:
Retrieve rows from a draft HubDB table with optional filtering.

This tool fetches rows from the draft version of a specified HubDB table. It allows for filtering and sorting rows based on query parameters, helping to access only relevant data.

parameters.name: table_id_or_name
parameters.description: The ID or name of the HubDB table to query for draft rows.

value_schema.description: The ID or name of the table to query.

parameters.name: sort_columns
parameters.description: List of column names to sort the results by. Use format like ['column1', '-column2'] to specify ascending or descending order.

value_schema.description: Specifies the column names to sort the results by.

parameters.name: next_page_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor token to retrieve the next set of results, from `paging.next.after` in a paged response.

value_schema.description: The cursor token value to get the next set of results. You can get this from the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: maximum_results_limit
parameters.description: Specifies the maximum number of results to return from the draft table. Default is 1000.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is `1000`.

parameters.name: specified_columns
parameters.description: Specify the column names to return only these columns in the result, instead of all columns.

value_schema.description: Specify the column names to get results containing only the required columns instead of all column details. If you want to include multiple columns in the result, use this query param as many times.

parameters.name: result_offset
parameters.description: The number of rows to skip before starting to collect the result set from the draft version of a table.

parameters.name: include_archived_rows
parameters.description: Specify whether to include archived rows in the results. Use `true` to include archived rows, `false` to exclude them.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the hubspot_cms API.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Specifies the column names to sort the results by.

value_schema.description: Specifies the column names to sort the results by.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: The cursor token value to get the next set of results. You can get this from the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

value_schema.description: The cursor token value to get the next set of results. You can get this from the `paging.next.after` JSON property of a paged response containing more results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is `1000`.

value_schema.description: The maximum number of results to return. Default is `1000`.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Specify the column names to get results containing only the required columns instead of all column details. If you want to include multiple columns in the result, use this query param as many times.

value_schema.description: Specify the column names to get results containing only the required columns instead of all column details. If you want to include multiple columns in the result, use this query param as many times.

parameters.name: tableIdOrName
parameters.description: The ID or name of the table to query.

value_schema.description: The ID or name of the table to query.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
